main event: A UFO was observed near Westcliffe, Colorado on August 12, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as circular, larger than a car but smaller than a house, and yellow/shiny in color.
The object was seen from a distance of about 3/4 mile and appeared to be pointed at the top, tent-shaped, and sitting on 4 legs.
The object was spotted by a witness and 3 other people in the party, from an elevation of 11,000 feet on the east side of Marble Mountain outside Westcliffe.
The sighting lasted for approximately 1 hour, during which time a rainstorm occurred and the witness left the area.

The Air Force was unable to determine the cause of the sighting, noting that recent publicity about a similar incident in Alamosa, Colorado may have contributed to the observers' interest and imagination.
sighted object: a circular, yellow/shiny object larger than a car but smaller than a house
